oracle.kubernetes.operator.authentication

Class Authenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.kubernetes.operator.authentication.Authenticator

  • public class Authenticator
extends Object
    This class contains methods to authenticate to the Kubernetes API Server in different ways and to create API clients with the desired credentials.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Authenticator()
      Create a new instace of the Authenticator class containing the default API client.
      Authenticator(io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient apiClient)
      Create a new instance of Authenticator with the provided API Client.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeClient(io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient apiClient)
      Close the ApiClient to make sure any open connection is cleaned up.
      io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName(String serviceAccountName)
      Given a serviceAccountName (not restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
      io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName(String serviceAccountName, String namespace)
      Given a serviceAccountName (restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
      io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient createClientByToken(String token)
      Given a token look through all service accounts for a secret that matches the token.
      io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient getApiClient()
      Get the API client.
      Helpers getHelper()
      Get a reference to ServiceHelper.
      String getServiceToken()
      Get the service token.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Authenticator

        public Authenticator()
              throws IOException
        Create a new instace of the Authenticator class containing the default API client. The default client will normally use ~/.kube/config or the file pointed to by $KUBECONFIG outside a Kubernetes cluster, or the default Service Account inside a Kubernetes cluster (i.e. in a Container in a Pod).
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an API error.

      • Authenticator

        public Authenticator(io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient apiClient)
        Create a new instance of Authenticator with the provided API Client. Called by KubernetesClient class to setup client and config objects.
        Parameters:
        apiClient - The API Client to create the Authenticator with.

    • Method Detail

      • getApiClient

        public io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient getApiClient()
        Get the API client.
        Returns:
        the ApiClient object.

      • getHelper

        public Helpers getHelper()
        Get a reference to ServiceHelper.
        Returns:
        the ServiceHelper object.

      • getServiceToken

        public String getServiceToken()
        Get the service token.
        Returns:
        the ServiceToken object.

      • createClientByToken

        public io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient createClientByToken(String token)
                                                   throws io.kubernetes.client.ApiException,
                                                          IOException
        Given a token look through all service accounts for a secret that matches the token. Then create an authenticated client for that service account.
        Parameters:
        token - service token for search.
        Returns:
        ApiClient that has been properly authenticated
        Throws:
        io.kubernetes.client.ApiException - on API Exception
        IOException - on IO Exception

      • createClientByServiceAccountName

        public io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName(String serviceAccountName)
                                                                throws io.kubernetes.client.ApiException
        Given a serviceAccountName (not restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
        Parameters:
        serviceAccountName - The name of the Service Account.
        Returns:
        ApiClient that has been properly authenticated.
        Throws:
        io.kubernetes.client.ApiException - if the API call fails.

      • createClientByServiceAccountName

        public io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName(String serviceAccountName,
                                                                       String namespace)
                                                                throws io.kubernetes.client.ApiException
        Given a serviceAccountName (restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
        Parameters:
        serviceAccountName - The name of the Service Account.
        namespace - The name of the Namespace.
        Returns:
        ApiClient that has been properly authenticated.
        Throws:
        io.kubernetes.client.ApiException - if there is an API error.

      • closeClient

        public void closeClient(io.kubernetes.client.ApiClient apiClient)
                 throws io.kubernetes.client.ApiException
        Close the ApiClient to make sure any open connection is cleaned up.
        Parameters:
        apiClient - ApiClient object that you want to close.
        Throws:
        io.kubernetes.client.ApiException - if there is an API error.
